UniprotID	H7BYX9

EntryName	H7BYX9_HUMAN
ProteinName	Vitamin K-dependent protein C (EC 3.4.21.69) (Anticoagulant protein C) (Autoprothrombin IIA) (Blood coagulation factor XIV)
GeneName	PROC
Length	236
Function	Protein C is a vitamin K-dependent serine protease that regulates blood coagulation by inactivating factors Va and VIIIa in the presence of calcium ions and phospholipids. Exerts a protective effect on the endothelial cell barrier function.
Subcellular Location	Endoplasmic reticulum; Golgi apparatus; Secreted
Disorder
